required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Safety of Etanercept in Treatment of Patients With Moderate to Severe Psoriasiswith Etanercept
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Safety in Patients With Moderate to Severe Psoriasis Treated With Etanercept

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

primary_outcome.measure: Dermatology Quality of Life Index, Psoriasis Quality of Life Index and Physician Global assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction and/or withdrawal of systemic therapies, Proportion of patients with plaque psoriasis achieving PASI 50, 75 and 90 at each evaluation and BSA at each evaluation

intervention.description: recommended dose of enbrel is 25mg administered twice weekly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Informed consent signed by patients prior to study entry
2. 18 years of age or older at screening visit
3. Patients with moderate to severe psoriasis
4. Patients who have failed conventional systemic treatment
5. Patients who have a contraindication to conventional systemic therapy
6. Patients who are intolerant to conventional systemic therapy
7. A negative serum pregnancy test at screening in women of childbearing potential
8. Able to self-inject study drug or have a designee who can do so
9. In the opinion of the investigator, the patient will be able to comply with the requirements of the protocol

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

responsible_party.name_title: Wyeth (Registry Contact: Clinial Trials Registry Specialist)
